lead_paragraph: WIGDER--Harriet (Fein). We regret to announce the untimely passing of Harriet (Fein) Wigder. Harriet was born in Brooklyn, NY on June 23, 1930 to Betty and Victor Fein. She was a graduate of Hunter College and obtained a Master of Arts degrees from Teachers College, Columbia University. Harriet was an elementary school teacher in the New York City public school system. She had a special fondness for children, their education and integration into the mainstream of New York cultural life. Harriet was an early devotee of the fledgling State of Israel and visited Israel in her teenage years and many times thereafter. She was married to Dr. Bernard Wigder and they lived in Riverdale, New York for many years. They were actively involved in community charitable activities and were supportive of the Jewish Theological Seminary and the Riverdale Jewish Center. In retirement the Wigders lived in Pembroke Pines, Florida and continued their participation there in communal affairs. Bernard died in 2005. Harriet remained the beloved matriarch of her family and the extended Feinzeig clan. She passed away last Shabbat afternoon, January 2, 2016 with her immediate family in attendance. Harriet leaves her brother Jack, her sister-in- law Karin and her niece Shifra, who treasure her memory. Contributions in her name should be directed to the Hadassah Women's Organization. 1/3
